name: CreateOnCallEscalationPolicy
description:
Create a new On-Call escalation policy in Datadog.

This tool is used to create a new On-Call escalation policy in Datadog. Call this tool when you need to set up or adjust escalation protocols within your team for handling alerts.

parameters.name: escalation_policy_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing details for creating the escalation policy, including attributes, relationships, and resource type.

name.description: Specifies the name for the new escalation policy.

resolve_page_on_policy_end.description: Indicates whether the page is automatically resolved when the policy ends.

retries.description: Specifies how many times the escalation sequence is retried if there is no response.

assignment.description: Specifies how this escalation step will assign targets (example `default` or `round-robin`).

escalate_after_seconds.description: Defines how many seconds to wait before escalating to the next step.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier for this target.

type.description: Specifies the type of escalation target (example `users`, `schedules`, or `teams`).

targets.description: Specifies the collection of escalation targets for this step.

steps.description: A list of escalation steps, each defining assignment, escalation timeout, and targets for the new policy.

attributes.description: Defines the attributes for creating an escalation policy, including its description, name, resolution behavior, retries, and steps.

id.description: The unique identifier of the team in this relationship.

data.description: An array of team references for this schedule.

teams.description: Associates teams with this schedule in a data structure.

relationships.description: Represents relationships in an escalation policy creation request, including references to teams.

type.description: Indicates that the resource is of type `policies`.

data.description: Represents the data for creating an escalation policy, including its attributes, relationships, and resource type.
